title: Always seeing "Dropping unsynced node during sync" messages
body:
## My Environment
Geth
Version: 1.10.5-stable
Architecture: amd64
Go Version: go1.16.3
Operating System: ubuntu20.04 server

## My genesis.json
```json
{
    "config": {
        "chainId": 112,
        "homsteadBlock": 0,
```

## My Operation:
In `ubuntu1` node, I execute:
```sh
bootnode --genkey=boot.key
bootnode --nodekey=boot.key
```
Output:
```
enode://c2606d9b5056a7ce05ca516d2cb3ebabbcd7189f2183a22fda4ea74d489836056cd583e3668efb27a2d882ca2d9ee5975705ade3059cd7b6d015521c1cbedd82@127.0.0.1:0?discport=30301
Note: you're using cmd/bootnode, a developer tool.
We recommend using a regular node as bootstrap node for production deployments.
INFO [07-18|02:49:46.611] New local node record                    seq=1 id=3a0a3d12e3c0b551 ip=<nil> udp=0 tcp=0
```
This node as a bootnode.

In `ubuntu2` and `ubuntu3` node, I execute:
```sh
geth --datadir=$(pwd)/data init genesis.json
geth --datadir=$(pwd)/data --bootnodes="enode://c2606d9b5056a7ce05ca516d2cb3ebabbcd7189f2183a22fda4ea74d489836056cd583e3668efb27a2d882ca2d9ee5975705ade3059cd7b6d015521c1cbedd82@ubuntu1:30301" --networkid=112 console
```

## My Problem
This is the output on `ubuntu2` and `ubuntu3`:
```
INFO [07-18|14:59:26.605] Looking for peers                        peercount=0 tried=0  static=0
```

They don't seem to connect, It can't work. Did I do something wrong?
Can someone help me? Thank you.
